member.name: T:AutoCount.Document.CreditTerm
member.summary:
CreditTerm class encapsulates the logic of Credit Term in AutoCount program. You can create a simple CreditTerm with COD as default, or you can create a simple CreditTerm of DueInNumberOfDays, or you can pass a valid term string to the constructor, and let the CreditTerm parser to determine the type of the CreditTerm.
To get the string representation of the CreditTerm object, use ToString method.
To get the due date of any invoice date, use GetDueDate.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateNoDeMinimisContentOne
member.summary: Since GST partial exemption module is disable, so residual input tax recovery rate (IRR) is 0%. (IRR cannot be calculated)

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateContentThree
F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateContentTwo
member.summary:
REC = RE * IRR

REC = Residual Input Tax Claimable Amount
RE = Residual Input Tax Amount
IRR = Residual Input Tax Recovery Rate

RE = {0}
IRR = {1}%

REC = {0} * {1}%
REC = {2}

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateContentOneFail
F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateContentOnePass
member.summary: Since de minimis rule is pass, so residual input tax recovery rate (IRR) is 100%.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.IRRateSubtitleOne
member.summary: 1. Calculate Residual Input Tax Recovery Rate

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisSummaryOneFail
member.summary: Conclusion, either one or both rules for 2(a) & 2(b) are fail. Therefore, the result is fail.\n- Non-incidental exempt input tax (TX-ES) is not allow to claim\n- Residual input tax (TX-RE) need to calculate using residual input tax recovery rate (IRR) to find out tax claim.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisSummaryOnePass
member.summary: Conclusion, both rules for 2(a) & 2(b) are pass. Therefore, the result is pass.\n- Non-incidental exempt input tax (TX-ES) is allow fully claim\n- Residual input tax (TX-RE) is allow fully claim, so residual input tax recovery rate (IRR) is 100%

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentSummaryThreeFail
member.summary: Since DA > {0} (per month), so this rule is fail.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentSummaryThreePass
member.summary: Since DA <= {0} (per month), so this rule is pass.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentThree
F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentSummaryTwoFail
member.summary: Since DP > {0}%, so this rule is fail.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentSummaryTwoPass
member.summary: Since DP <= {0}%, so this rule is pass.

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentTwo
member.summary:
DP = ES / (T + ES) * 100
DP <= {0}%

DP = De Minimis Rule Percentage
ES = Exempt Supplies (Taxable Amount)
T = Value of Taxable Supplies (Taxable Amount)

ES = {1}
T = {2}

DP = {1} / ({2} + {1}) * 100
DP = {3}%

member.name: F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.DeMinimisContentOne
F:AutoCount.Tax.MalaysiaGST.GSTPartialExemption.GSTPartialExemptionStringId.NoDeMinimisSummaryOne
member.summary: Since Exempt Supplies (ES) does not have value, so no need to apply De Minimis Rule. Therefore, the result is fail.\n- Non-incidental exempt input tax (TX-ES) is not allow to claim\n- Residual input tax (TX-RE) need to calculate using residual input tax recovery rate (IRR) to find out tax claim.

member.summary:
GetUpToDateBalance calculates the Up-To-Date Balance for a particular Account No by date. Up-To-Date Balance means the Balance for This Year and Opening. (Usually only Balance Sheet Accounts has Opening Balance)
GetUpToDateBalance first calculate the Up-To-Date Balance until previous Period, then if there are some remaining day portion, then it will calculate the balance from GLDTL and add together.
member.param: The date of the Up-To-Date Balance.

member.name: M:AutoCount.Consolidate.OfflineAccountBalance.GetBalance(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: GetBalance gets the balance amount for a particular account no for All project and All department.
member.param: The start date of the balance.
The end date of the balance.

member.name: M:AutoCount.Consolidate.OfflineAccountBalance.GetBalance(System.String,AutoCount.GL.Dimension,AutoCount.GL.Dimension,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: GetBalance gets the balance amount for a particular account no for a Dimension of project and a Dimension of department.
member.param: It defines whether you want to calculate All Projects, By Project Range, or By Individual project, if the project is a parent project, all the balance of its sub-projects will be calculated together.

It defines whether you want to calculate All Departments, By Department Range, or By Individual department, if the department is a parent department, all the balance of its sub-departments will be calculated together.
The start date of the balance.
The end date of the balance.

member.name: M:AutoCount.GL.AccountBalance.GetUpToDateBalance(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Gets the Up-To-Date Balance for a particular Account No by date. Up-To-Date Balance means the Balance for This Year and Opening. (Usually only Balance Sheet Accounts has Opening Balance)
GetUpToDateBalance first calculate the Up-To-Date Balance until previous Period, then if there are some remaining day portion, then it will calculate the balance from GLDTL and add together.
member.param: The date of the Up-To-Date Balance.

Float Day for the cheque to clear
paymentAmt, positive for receipt, negative for payment

The Location of the Stock Detail Record
The Batch No. of the Stock Detail Record
The Proj. No. of the Stock Detail Record
The Dept. No. of the Stock Detail Record
The date of the Stock Detail Record
The Qty of the Stock Detail Record, positive Qty means Stock In, negative Qty means Stock Out
The Cost of the Stock Detail Record

For Stock Transfer, the In record will refer to Out record with this referTo, however, it is in negative format. For C/N, the referTo refers to the Invoice's (or D/O's) StockDTLKey, in positive format.

member.name: M:AutoCount.Stock.UTDCosting.GetNewUTDCost(AutoCount.Stock.UTDCostHelper,System.Decimal,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the UTD Cost for a given Quantity of new Item. Assume qty is in positive If the Costing Method is FIFO or LIFO, then will return a DataTable which contains a multiple records of qty-cost pair. Otherwise, the return value is null. The totalCost contains the total cost of this calculation, if you want to get the average unit cost, then you must divide by qty.

member.name: M:AutoCount.Stock.UTDCosting.GetEditUTDCost(AutoCount.Stock.UTDCostHelper,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,AutoCount.Stock.FIFOCost,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the UTD Cost for a given Quantity of Editing Item. Assume oldQty and newQty is in positive If the Costing Method is FIFO or LIFO, then will return a DataTable which contains a multiple records of qty-cost pair. Otherwise, the return value is null. The totalCost contains the total cost of this calculation, if you want to get the average unit cost, then you must divide by qty.

member.name: T:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup
member.summary: Implements Startup and Shutdown of AutoCount Accounting. Any program must call the startup methods in this class first before attempting to access to AutoCount Accounting.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.GetProgramStartupArguments
member.summary: Get the current application arguments to be used in Process.Start.
member.returns: Return a string containing the program arguments

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.SubProjectStartup(AutoCount.Authentication.UserSession)
member.summary: Call this method by passing in a UserSession object in a sub-project of AutoCount Accounting.
member.remarks: This method is called if you works on a sub-project of AutoCount Accounting. By calling to this method, all underlying initialization work will be done.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.SubProjectStartup(AutoCount.Authentication.UserSession,AutoCount.MainEntry.StartupPlugInOption)
member.summary: Call this method by passing in a UserSession object in a sub-project of AutoCount Accounting.
member.remarks: This method is called if you works on a sub-project of AutoCount Accounting. By calling to this method, all underlying initialization work will be done.
member.param: A StartupPlugInOption to control whether to load plug-in or not.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.Shutdown
member.remarks: This method is used to logout CurrentUserSession.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.Initialize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Actual initialization code, allow inherited class to override, this code will be executed in a new task.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.InitStartup(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize AutoCount Accounting. This code will be run once, and it will be called from SubProjectStartup, SubProjectStartupWithLogin, Start methods.

member.name: M:AutoCount.MainEntry.Startup.SetDefaultOEM
member.summary: SetDefaultOEM is intended for AutoCount Internal Projects called.
